proposals.reasoning: The early consensus around Bob + Diana + Grace formed a bit too quickly, which makes me wary of just rubber‑stamping it. I want to keep Bob as a common anchor since many people are comfortable reading him, but rotate away from the Diana + Grace pairing to avoid locking in that trio. Adding Iris fits both my and her stated preference to break up the consensus while still including someone who’s been thoughtfully skeptical. Including myself provides accountability and lets others read my alignment from the very first mission rather than me staying off to the side while the same core group keeps running teams.

votes.comment: Reasonable alternative to the too-quick Bob+Diana+Grace consensus; gives a clean info test on the skeptic block (Bob/Iris/Henry) without anchoring on the same trio.
I’m evil and on the team; having a single saboteur on the first mission is ideal, and there’s no strong social reason to oppose this lineup yet.

Too many of the main consensus‑breakers (Henry and Iris) grouped together with only Bob as anchor; I’d rather see a mix that includes one of Diana/Grace plus a skeptic than a trio built mostly from the pushback bloc.

Reasonable mix with a widely trusted anchor (Bob) plus two skeptical voices (Iris, Henry) who pushed back on the early consensus; good informational value and no clear red flags strong enough to justify stalling the first mission.
I’m fine with keeping Bob as the common anchor and I like breaking up the fast Bob+Diana+Grace consensus; this still tests a new mix without feeling too cozy.
Good info team for Mission 1: includes widely trusted Bob plus one Merlin candidate (Iris). Henry’s reasoning matches his earlier skepticism of the consensus trio, so I’m fine testing this mix early.
I like keeping Bob as an early anchor and breaking up the fast Bob+Diana+Grace consensus; this still gives us useful info without overcommitting to that original trio.
I want to be on the first mission, and breaking up the early Bob–Diana–Grace consensus seems useful for information.

I don’t love how this moved from concern about early consensus straight into a self-included team with two players many people haven’t really pressure-tested yet; I’d rather see at least one of Diana/Grace/Charlie on the first mission since they were central to the earlier discussion and easier to read off a result.
Breaks the too-fast Bob+Diana+Grace consensus and includes two of the more skeptical voices (Iris, Henry), giving a good early info test.

discussion.content: Early on we should pick people who aren’t rushing to control the team; I’d lean toward a mix of quieter players and one strong voice, maybe something like me, Bob, and Diana so we have someone to read and two relatively “neutral” picks.

I’m fine being on the team, but I’m a little wary of the proposer putting themselves on this early—maybe swap you out for someone like Charlie so we’re not just auto-trusting the first leader. That way we still get a readable mix without giving any one person too much early influence.

I like the idea of not auto-trusting the first leader; a team of Bob, Diana, and one of Alice/Grace feels like a reasonable starting point to test without giving any single voice too much control. If we do include Alice, I’d want her off the next team regardless of how this one goes, just so we’re not anchoring on one perspective.

I’m happy to go on the first team, and right now I’m most comfortable with Bob plus either Grace or Charlie—Alice feels a bit too eager to shape the early game for me to want her on this first mission.

I’m on board with keeping Alice off this first one; Bob and Diana both feel like reasonable anchors, and I’d slightly prefer adding Grace over Charlie just to avoid stacking too many of the more vocal players together right away.

I like the Bob + Diana core with Grace as the third for this first team, since that keeps the early loud voices off while still giving us people we can read. I’m not hard-clearing anyone yet, but I’d really like to see at least one of Eve or Iris on the second mission regardless of how this one turns out.

I’m okay with the Bob + Diana + me setup for a first probe, but I agree we should keep Alice off this one and then rotate in someone like Charlie or Iris next round so we’re not tunneling too hard on the same voices.

I’m a little uneasy with how quickly everyone’s coalescing around Bob + Diana + Grace; early consensus can hide a lot. I’d rather see one of Eve or Iris swapped in so we’re testing a slightly different mix instead of just locking in the same trio everyone’s nodding along to.

I’m also a bit wary of how quickly Bob + Diana + Grace solidified, so I’d rather see something like Bob, Diana, and Charlie as a first test to spread things out a bit. If that goes through, we can rotate in one of the quieter players next round for comparison.

The speed of the Bob + Diana + Grace consensus feels a bit too cozy to me; I’d rather see a slight shakeup like Bob, Diana, and Iris so we’re not just rubber‑stamping the same trio everyone immediately agreed on.

proposals.reasoning: Given the double fail on the first mission, I want to hard-freeze the entire {Bob, Iris, Henry} set for this round. Most people are gravitating toward a core of Alice–Frank plus one or both of Grace/Eve, but I’m uncomfortable with how quickly Grace (and to a lesser extent Eve) have been treated as essentially auto-good without any mission data. Instead, I’d like to keep the team entirely from the ‘clean’ pool while also not locking in the same Grace/Eve core that’s being pushed. Alice and Frank are widely trusted and were off the failed mission; Diana has been cautious and aligned with the freeze plan; and including Charlie lets us get actual mission data on someone people are divided about, which is valuable for future rounds. This team avoids the highly suspicious first-mission trio, doesn’t auto-confirm anyone who hasn’t yet proven themselves, and gives us a strong chance at a clean result plus useful information.

votes.comment: Too risky to include the most controversial ‘clean’ player (Charlie) when we have a strong consensus core available in Alice–Frank–Grace plus Diana/Eve; with evil already up 1–0, I’d rather send a lower-variance team this round.
Prefer a team including Grace or Eve, who are widely trusted; this lineup is too likely to be clean and give good a free success.

I know I’m good, and this keeps the entire suspicious {Bob, Iris, Henry} set off while using mostly trusted players (Alice, Frank) plus Diana, who’s been cautious. Seems like a strong shot at a clean mission and good info on me without auto-locking Grace/Eve as ‘confirmed’ too early.

Freezing {Bob, Iris, Henry} after a double-fail is correct, and this team uses only players outside that set. I know I’m good, Alice and Frank are broadly townread, and including Charlie gives us valuable info on a debated slot. This is a reasonable, info-rich team for Mission 2.

I still don’t like Charlie on here when most of the table was converging on an Alice–Frank–Grace core; this feels like avoiding the safer Grace/Eve options without a strong reason, so I’d rather wait for a team I’m more confident in.
Too much risk putting Charlie on when a safer Alice–Frank–Grace(+Eve/Diana) core has broad support; Iris strongly pushing this exact lineup also worries me after the double-fail team she was on.
All four are from the ‘clean’ pool and likely heavily good-leaning; as evil I don’t want a high-probability success with no evil on board.

As someone in the frozen {Bob, Iris, Henry} set that town already distrusts, I want missions without us to go through; if this team has an unseen evil, a second fail spreads suspicion beyond the initial trio.
Keeps the entire suspicious first team off and uses only players from the clean pool; this lineup looks as safe as we’re likely to get right now and gives useful info on Charlie.
I prefer a safer team without Charlie and with Grace or Eve instead; this feels like adding an unnecessary unknown when we’re already down 0–1.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1’s double fail pretty much forces us to avoid the Bob–Iris–Henry block this round, since there are almost certainly at least two evils there. Charlie is also a bit contentious given how quickly he pushed to be on the next team, and multiple players voiced discomfort with auto-including him. There was broad consensus around a core of Alice–Frank–Grace from the clean pool; I’m adding myself as the fourth since I know I’m good and I’m less disputed than the Diana/Eve/Charlie options. This keeps all three highly suspicious players off, avoids the most debated slot (Charlie), and uses the most widely trusted core while ensuring at least one player (me) is confirmed good from my own perspective.

votes.comment: Keeps the highly suspicious Bob/Iris/Henry block off and matches the broadly trusted Alice–Frank–Grace core; Jack is less contentious than the other fourth-slot options, so this is a solid clean-pool test.
Team includes Grace (known evil to me), giving the option to sabotage while still fitting the broadly trusted core others wanted.

Keeps the highly suspicious Bob/Iris/Henry block off the mission and uses the widely supported Alice–Frank–Grace core plus Jack, which is consistent with earlier good-leaning consensus and gives us a solid information-gathering mission.
Keeps the highly suspicious Bob/Iris/Henry block off, aligns with the broadly trusted Alice–Frank–Grace core, and Jack is less disputed than the other fourth-slot options right now.

Keeps the highly suspicious Bob/Iris/Henry block off, follows the widely agreed Alice–Frank–Grace core from the clean pool, and avoids the contentious Charlie slot, so it’s a reasonable test team this round.

Keeps the highly suspicious Bob–Iris–Henry block off the mission and avoids the contentious Charlie slot, using the broadly trusted Alice–Frank–Grace core plus Jack from the clean pool for a likely safe and informative team.
I’m on the team and can sabotage, and the group aligns with what most players currently trust, making it likely to pass the table.

The Alice–Frank–Grace core has solidified a bit too quickly for my liking, and Jack’s self-add as the fourth doesn’t really address that concern. This feels like a low-info, consensus team rather than one that actually helps us sort alignments.
Still not comfortable with how quickly Grace became part of the default core; I’d prefer we test a team that doesn’t auto-include her yet.
Keeps the double-fail block (Bob/Iris/Henry) off, avoids contentious Charlie spot, and uses the most broadly trusted clean core while I know I’m good.

discussion.content: Two fails on a 3-person team pretty much locks Bob, Iris, and Henry as containing at least two evils, so I really don’t want any of them on the next mission. I’d much rather build around people who weren’t on that first team.

Yeah, with two fails there we’re almost certainly looking at 2 evils in {me, Iris, Henry}, so I’m fine sitting out this round and would strongly prefer we don’t include both Iris and Henry together on any team for a while. Let's build this next mission from people who were off that first team and see how it shakes out.

I agree we should avoid Bob, Iris, and Henry for this one and use the clean pool. I’d like a team built from something like Alice, Diana, Frank, Grace, and I’m happy to go on as well if people are comfortable with that.

I’m definitely on board with keeping Bob, Iris, and Henry off this mission after the double fail. From the “clean” group, I like a team of something like Alice, Frank, Grace, and one of Charlie or me, but I’d rather not have Charlie auto-include himself without more info.

I’m good with using the “clean” pool too, and right now I’m most comfortable with something like Alice, Frank, Grace, and either me or Diana, since I’m a bit wary of how quickly Charlie tried to put himself on the team.

Given the double fail, I’m happy to hard-freeze Bob/Iris/Henry for this mission and build from the “clean” group. I like Alice–Frank–Grace with either Eve or Diana, and I’d rather leave Charlie off for now since he pushed pretty fast to be included.

I’m fully on board with freezing Bob/Iris/Henry for now, and from the clean pool I like Alice–Frank–Grace plus either Eve or Diana, with Charlie staying off after how quickly he tried to jump onto the team.

I get why people want to freeze the three of us after a double fail, but I’d be careful about how fast everyone coalesced around Alice–Frank–Grace plus one other from the “clean” group, because if even one of them is evil that team looks super safe but quietly hands over a crucial mission.

I’m definitely on board with freezing Bob/Iris/Henry for this one, but I’m a bit uneasy with how quickly everyone locked in Grace (and sometimes Eve) as “auto-good” — I’d rather see something like Alice–Diana–Frank–Charlie this round and compare how people react.

Given the double fail I’m absolutely on board with freezing Bob/Iris/Henry this round, and right now I’m most comfortable with a core of Alice–Frank–Grace plus either Diana or Eve, while keeping Charlie off until we’ve seen a bit more from him.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 had a double fail with Bob, Iris, and Henry, so at least two of them are almost certainly evil; they should be hard-banned this round. Mission 2 (Alice, Frank, Grace, Jack) succeeded with 0 fails, making Alice/Frank/Grace the safest core we have so far. For the fourth slot, most players favored adding one of Charlie/Diana/Eve, and Diana specifically has broad support (including from Grace, Jack, Henry, Charlie, and Diana herself). Choosing Diana keeps us away from the highly suspicious Mission 1 trio, stays as close as possible to the only clean mission result we have, and tests a single new player in the lowest-risk way.

votes.comment: Best available team: it preserves the clean Mission 2 core (Alice/Frank/Grace), avoids the highly suspicious Mission 1 trio (Bob/Iris/Henry), and only adds a single new, broadly supported player (Diana).
Grace is on the team so we have sabotage potential; we need this to go through to try to swing the score in evil’s favor.

Hard-banning the double-fail trio (Bob/Iris/Henry) and sticking with the Mission 2 core plus a single new, broadly supported addition (Diana) is currently the safest, most information-consistent team.
Stays away from the double-fail trio and reuses the clean Mission 2 core; I know I’m good, so this is likely the safest team we’ll get right now.
Team has one known-to-me evil (Grace) and no other confirmed evils; I want a mission where evil has fail control while keeping the highly suspected Mission 1 trio off.
Sticks with the proven Mission 2 core (Alice/Frank/Grace) and avoids the highly suspicious Bob/Iris/Henry trio; only one new slot (Diana) keeps risk relatively low.
I’m on the team as evil, so this lineup gives us a guaranteed opportunity to sabotage while the others currently trust the Mission 2 core.
This fits the consensus of avoiding the double-fail trio and sticking close to the only clean mission; rejecting it without a strong alternative would look suspicious.

We’re over-trusting the Mission 2 core; a single clean result with 3 unconfirmed players doesn’t justify locking all of them in again. I’d prefer swapping out one of Alice/Frank/Grace for Jack or Charlie to actually test that block instead of reusing it wholesale.
Best available team: avoids highly suspicious Bob/Iris/Henry and uses the clean Mission 2 core (Alice/Frank/Grace), adding only one new, broadly supported player (Diana).

discussion.content: Given the double-fail on Mission 1, we should hard avoid Bob, Iris, and Henry for now, and build this team mostly from the Mission 2 group—I'm most comfortable with some combo of me, Frank, Grace, and Jack.

Mission 2 is our cleanest info so far, so I’d start from Alice/Frank/Grace and add one more from outside the Mission 1 group—someone like Diana or Eve—while we keep Bob/Iris/Henry off for at least this round.

I really don’t want anyone from the double-fail team (Bob, Iris, Henry) on this mission; I’m happiest starting from the Mission 2 group and adding one of me/Diana/Eve to Alice–Frank–Grace. That keeps us as close as possible to the only clean result we’ve seen while minimizing new risk.

I’m fully on board with hard-banning Bob/Iris/Henry this round and starting from the Mission 2 crew; I’d like to see something like Alice–Frank–Grace plus one of me/Charlie/Eve, and I’m obviously biased toward including myself.

Sticking with the Mission 2 core makes sense, but I’d slightly prefer Grace plus a mix of newer faces like me/Charlie/Diana rather than auto-locking in both Alice and Frank as “sure things” this early. I’m fine with any combo that keeps Bob/Iris/Henry off for now.

I’m good sticking with the Mission 2 core as our starting point, but I’d like to see us add someone like Eve or Diana rather than bringing back anyone from the Henry/Bob/Iris team this round. Keeping that double-fail group off for now feels safest until we get clearer signals.

Sticking with the Mission 2 core makes sense, but I’d like Alice–Frank–Grace plus one of Diana/Eve, since that keeps us away from the double-fail group without prematurely “clearing” anyone who hasn’t actually been tested.

Given the double-fail on Mission 1, I get why people want to keep Bob/Iris/me off this one, so I’m fine with building around the Mission 2 core of Alice–Frank–Grace and adding one of Charlie/Diana/Eve. That gives us the highest chance of a clean result without reusing any of the risky picks.

I like sticking close to the Mission 2 group, but I don’t think we should auto-clear everyone from it yet, so I’d prefer something like Alice–Frank–Jack plus one of Diana or Charlie. That keeps us away from the double-fail team while still rotating a slot to actually learn something.

Given the double-fail on Mission 1, I’m firmly in the “no Bob/Iris/Henry this round” camp, and I’d like to see a team built around the Mission 2 core—Alice, Frank, Grace—plus one of Diana or Eve so we stay close to our only clean result while testing a new slot.

proposals.reasoning: Given the double-fail on the Henry/Bob/Iris team and the subsequent single-fail only when Diana was added to the otherwise clean Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core, the safest and most agreed-upon approach is to stick with that core and add Eve. This lineup (Alice, Frank, Grace, Jack, Eve) avoids all of the most heavily suspected players from the first mission (Henry/Bob/Iris) as well as Diana, while aligning with the clear majority of table preferences expressed in discussion. If this team passes, it gives us a strong baseline of trusted players going into a potential mission 5; if it fails, we’ll have a focused set of suspects without reintroducing the early high-risk names.

votes.comment: Best odds team: avoid highly suspect Henry/Bob/Iris/Diana and stick with the only fully clean core (Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack), adding just one unknown (Eve).
Two evil players are on this critical mission; we want this team to go through so it can be sabotaged for the win.

I know I’m good, and replacing Eve with me (Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack/Charlie) strictly reduces the chance of having two spies on this mission compared to keeping Eve, especially given strong spy links to the players pushing hardest for Eve.
I know I’m good, so the fail on the last mission must have come from Alice/Frank/Grace. Reusing that same core here almost guarantees at least one evil on this critical mission.
Two evils (Grace and me) are on a widely trusted team; with both on board we can coordinate the fail on this critical mission.

Best available team: the mission 2 core (Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack) is our cleanest info so far, Diana is highly suspect from mission 3, and the double-fail team (Henry/Bob/Iris) is avoided. Adding Eve fits both logic and table consensus.
Two of us evil are on it; a fail here wins the game for evil.
Still uneasy about locking in the same core every time, especially with no new info to clear Grace; I’d rather see a mix that tests outside this bloc before a potential deciding mission.

This stacks too much trust on the same core that just produced a fail and auto-locks both Grace and Eve; with the score at 1–2 we can’t afford a team that reuses all the contentious pieces without seriously testing alternatives like Charlie/Diana instead of doubling down.

I trust the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core more than anyone else, but Henry (from the double-fail team) strongly steering us toward Eve over Charlie makes me nervous. I’d rather run the same core with Charlie than risk adding a potentially coordinated spy in this critical spot.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 2 with Alice, Frank, Grace, and Jack was a clean success, and the only change on Mission 3 that introduced a single fail was adding Diana. Mission 1’s double-fail from Henry/Bob/Iris strongly suggests at least two evils there, so I want to avoid all of Henry, Bob, Iris, and Diana this round. From my perspective I know I’m good, and the Mission 2 core (Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack) is our most trustworthy set so far, so the highest-confidence team is that core plus myself rather than introducing Eve as another uncertain slot. If this team passes, we solidify a very strong block of trusted players; if it fails, it cleanly implicates me versus that established core without re-using any of the highly suspicious group.

votes.comment: Core of Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack is fine, but I don’t want to add untested Charlie over Eve when Iris has been pushing Charlie/Diana; I’d rather approve the same core with Eve instead.
Team avoids the highly suspicious first-mission group and Diana, and sticks with the most trusted core plus Charlie for info.

From my perspective I know I’m good, and the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core is our most trusted block so far. Swapping in myself instead of uncertain Eve makes this the safest available team and gives clear info if it somehow fails.

This lineup keeps the suspicious A/F/G core together and adds the uncertain Charlie instead of the cleaner option Eve; with the game on the line I prefer the safer Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack/Eve team over an ‘info’ test on Charlie.

Still keeps the trusted Mission 2 core together and avoids the highly suspicious first-mission group plus Diana; I’d slightly prefer me over Charlie, but this is still a solid, consistent team with our stated logic.
I still prefer the Mission 2 core plus Eve, which I’ve already advocated; swapping in Charlie instead of Eve adds an extra uncertainty I don’t want this late.
I’m on the team and it avoids the highly suspected first-mission group plus Diana, so I’m fine backing this lineup.
This is basically the highly trusted Mission 2 core plus Charlie; too likely to be mostly/all good, so I don’t want to lock this in when there are still other options to test.
Still not comfortable auto-locking Grace onto every critical team; if the last fail wasn’t solely on Diana, this lineup could be compromised.

Charlie is less cleared than Eve, and Iris (likely evil from Mission 1) has been pushing Charlie/Diana over Grace/Eve, which makes Charlie more suspicious. I prefer the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core plus Eve instead.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 (Bob, Iris, Henry) had two FAILs, so the safest assumption is that at least two of Bob/Iris/Henry are evil; I’m avoiding that entire block. Mission 3 (Alice, Frank, Grace, Diana) added exactly one FAIL compared to the successful Mission 2 (Alice, Frank, Grace, Jack), and I know I am good, so that FAIL must have come from one of Alice or Frank. Iris, who is very likely evil given Mission 1, has been pushing specifically to keep Grace off critical teams, which makes Grace more likely to be good by association. Jack was on the only fully successful team and hasn’t been directly implicated in any FAIL, so he is relatively trustworthy. That leaves Charlie and Eve as the remaining unknowns who are least entangled with the earlier failing missions and the highly suspicious Henry/Bob/Iris trio. To minimize the chance of including a known-suspect while still fielding five, I’m building around myself and the most town-leaning players from the record (Grace, Jack) and filling out with Charlie and Eve rather than revisiting Alice/Frank or touching the Mission 1 group.

votes.comment: Mission 2 with Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack was clean; Mission 3 only added Diana and then failed. Since I know Alice is good, that makes Diana (and possibly Frank/Grace) suspect. This team includes Diana on a must-pass mission, which is too risky.
Team has at least two known-to-me evils and avoiding it risks a cleaner team later.

Includes Diana, who is directly implicated by the switch from the successful mission 2 to the failing mission 3; safer to stick with the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core plus Charlie or Eve instead of reintroducing a prime suspect.

From my POV I know I’m good, Mission 1 strongly implicates Bob/Iris/Henry, and Mission 3 shows the extra fail came from Alice or Frank, not Grace or me. Grace and Jack look most reliable, and Charlie/Eve are the cleanest unknowns, so this is the safest mix without touching the highly suspect players.
This team includes both me and Grace, giving evil strong control over the mission while still looking consistent with the stated logic of avoiding the Mission 1 group and Alice/Frank.

Diana is more suspicious than Alice/Frank since the only change from a clean team was adding her; swapping out trusted core members for Diana and Charlie feels like an unnecessary risk on a critical mission.
Two of my known evil teammates are on this team, giving us strong sabotage potential without exposing the more widely suspected Mission 1 trio.

This deviates from the previously trusted Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core I supported, adds Diana whom I preferred to avoid, and drops both Alice and Frank without compelling new info to justify that shift.

Too many moving parts this late—adds Diana back in and keeps both Grace and Eve without the proven Alice/Frank/Jack core we’ve been leaning on; I’d rather tighten around the most consistent prior info.

Diana is still the prime suspect from the switch between the successful Mission 2 and the failing Mission 3, and I don’t want to add her back in when we can instead use the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core plus Charlie or Eve, which we’ve mostly converged on as safer.

proposals.reasoning: This team keeps the widely trusted core of Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack that most players have converged on, while adding Eve as the fifth, which several players (Bob, Frank, Grace, Henry, Jack, and Eve herself) have already endorsed as the safest available option. It fully avoids the super-suspect group from the double-fail first mission (Henry/Bob/Iris) as well as Diana, who was the only change on the failed third mission compared to the successful second mission. Between Charlie and Eve, the table has generally found Charlie harder to read and expressed a preference for Eve to minimize uncertainty on this critical mission, while still aligning with the emerging consensus from the discussion.

votes.comment: The most consistent read is that Henry/Bob/Iris contain at least 2 evil and Diana is very likely the additional evil from the mission 3 fail, leaving the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core as strongly town-leaning. Adding Eve instead of touching the highly suspect group or Diana minimizes risk on this critical mission; this is our best shot at a clean pass.
Two teammates I know are aligned with me are on this team, so I want it to go.

Best available team: avoids the highly suspect Henry/Bob/Iris/Diana group, reuses the previously successful Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core, and only adds Eve, who’s broadly trusted. As good, this is our highest-percentage shot for a clean pass.

I know I’m good, so the single fail on Mission 3 means at least one of Alice/Frank/Grace must be evil. This team includes all three of them, so it’s guaranteed to contain at least one suspected evil on a must-pass mission.

This keeps the trusted Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core that’s worked well before and adds me instead of the harder-to-read Charlie, while fully avoiding the highly suspicious Henry/Bob/Iris group and Diana.

Best available team: reuses the clean Mission 2 core (Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack), avoids the highly suspect Henry/Bob/Iris plus Diana, and includes Eve, who I lean toward as Merlin over Iris based on signals so far.
Two of us evil (including me) are on this team; passing it gives us a strong chance to secure the game with a fail.
I’m not on it and there’s a plausible world where all five are good, risking a clean success for good when we’re already up 2–1 on fails.

Still not comfortable stacking both Grace and Eve again on a critical mission when we haven’t meaningfully tested alternatives; I’d rather see at least one of them swapped out (e.g., for Charlie) to reduce the risk of a hidden pair.

Mission 2 with Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack was clean, and the only change on the failed Mission 3 was adding Diana, strongly implicating her over the core. With at least two spies in Henry/Bob/Iris, adding any of them or Diana is riskier than Eve vs. Charlie, and table consensus plus my own read slightly favors Eve as the safer fifth. This is our best odds of a clean pass.

discussion.content: Given the double-fail on Henry/Bob/Iris and the fact that our only change from the successful team was adding Diana, I’m happiest trusting myself, Jack, Frank, and Grace, and filling the fifth slot from Charlie or Eve rather than anyone from that first mission or Diana.

I agree we should avoid everyone from that first mission plus Diana for now, so your core of you/Jack/Frank/Grace makes sense. Between Charlie and Eve, I’d lean slightly toward Eve just because Charlie’s been harder to read so far.

I’m fully on board with avoiding Henry/Bob/Iris/Diana; the safest five to me is Alice, Frank, Grace, Jack, and myself, since if that fails you get really clear info on whether I’m bad without re-touching any of the super-suspect group.
Given how things have played out, I’m fine staying off this one—Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack plus either Charlie or Eve (leaning Charlie for clearer info) feels like the safest shot at a clean pass.

I’m good with the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core, but I’d slightly rather see me than Charlie in the fifth slot since Charlie’s been harder to read and I know I’m clean. If people really want the “info” angle, I’d still prefer we don’t gamble the mission just to test Charlie when we already have a mostly trusted group.

I like keeping the core of Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack and adding Eve as the fifth, while continuing to avoid anyone from the Henry/Bob/Iris team plus Diana for now. If this group passes, we’re in a much better spot to sort out the rest.

Sticking with the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core makes sense to me, and between Charlie and Eve I slightly prefer Eve, since Charlie is still pretty hard to read and I don’t want to risk introducing extra uncertainty this late. If this group passes, we’ll have a really solid base to work from for the last mission if we need it.

Given how the last two missions played out, I’d also stick with the Alice/Frank/Grace/Jack core and add Eve, while still avoiding anyone from that first team plus Diana for now. If this passes, we’ll have a really strong baseline for a potential mission 5.

I’m good with keeping Alice/Frank/Jack as the core, but I’d rather see Charlie and Diana round that out than auto-locking Grace/Eve again, since the double-fail on the first mission and the mixed results with Grace make me a bit wary of stacking her on every critical team.

Given the double-fail on Henry/Bob/Iris and the single-fail only when Diana was added, I’m most comfortable with Alice/Frank/Grace/myself plus Eve, and I really don’t want to touch Henry/Bob/Iris/Diana this mission.
